section.name: Taking Screenshots of GUI Components
section.p: FEST-Swing provides support for taking screenshots of specific GUI components. This feature may be handy in cases when we want to verify that custom drawing/painting is being made by our application.

The class org.fest.swing.image.ScreenshotTaker provides two methods for taking screenshots of GUI components:
"takeScreenshotOf(java.awt.Component)" takes a screenshot of the given component and returns it as a java.awt.image.BufferedImage.
"saveComponentAsPng(java.awt.Component, String)" takes a screenshot of the given component and saves it as a PNG image using the file path passed as argument.

subsection.name: Comparing images
subsection.p: To test that two images are equal, we can use the method "isEqualTo(java.awt.image.BufferedImage)" in org.fest.assertion.ImageAssertion (part of the FEST-Assert module.) This method verifies that two images have the same size and the color of each pixel is the same between the two images.
